derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English (denoting a spicy sauce): perhaps from a misreading (as gravé) of Old French grané, probably from grain 'spice', from Latin granum 'grain'

entry.def: Gravy is a sauce made from the juices that come from meat when it cooks.

means.word_mean: 1. basically the juices that drip from cooking meats
2. a sudden happening that brings good fortune (as a sudden opportunity to make money);
